sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It's Monday, the 23rd of May. I'm Ralsan, and it's great to have you with us. Let's take a look at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Prussia continues to bomb eastern Ukraine around Severodonetsk and Lugansk, where Moscow continues to gain ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The World Economic Forum 2022 is on, and at the top of the Davos agenda is the war in Ukraine with Ukraine's president Volodymyr Zelensky delivering a keynote speech on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And Belgium imposes a 21-day mandatory quarantine for those infected with monkeypox

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: as the number of confirmed cases rise in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russia continued to bomb eastern Ukraine on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Their goal was to capture Severodonetsk and Lugansk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: According to the Institute for the Study of War, Russian forces have gained ground in the area and intensified their efforts to seize the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In an attempt to block the enemy troops from advancing, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed the bridge over the Donets River.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy spoke about the toll the war is taking on the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Today, up to 100 people may die in the east of our state. They are defending our country and our independence, which everyone in the world is talking about.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Everyone says so, but we personally feel it very much.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The cost of the war can be felt in places like Saltivka, once a densely populated residential neighborhood in Kharkiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Although Ukrainian forces managed to push back the Russian offensive, the city officials say that about a third of the buildings will have to be destroyed due to their unsafe conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Those who remain find themselves with no access to gas, water and a majority have no electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: However, they are forced to adapt to their new reality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And in Mariupol, home to the Azov-style steelworks, the charred carcasses of the buildings are all that remain of the once vibrant port city. Among the debris, the locals try to survive as Russian soldiers patrol the streets, now under their control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: control. pollster Levada sent a label to a foreign agent in Russia. Levada's recent polls also show that support for Vladimir Putin's decision is still high. It decreased just a little compared to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: March and that the majority believes it is NATO responsible for the destruction and deaths of civilians. It is important to mention that for most television is still the main source of information and that Russian TV is fully and totally controlled by the state. Facebook and Instagram are blocked and independent media are closed. Those who protest against the war are being detained. Most independent journalists as well as human rights activists left Russia for security reasons and many regular people those who disagree and disapprove dare to say what they think only behind their closed kitchen doors as it was back in the Soviet times. Galina Polonskaya, Euronews from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Alina and Kristina have spent the better part of the past three months underground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I wake up and brush my teeth, then I have breakfast, then I sit down for lessons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After school I have a little rest and then I have lunch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: After that we play on the street.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: When the siren starts or the bombing starts, we play in the basement. The moment they bomb, mum comes down, dad stays up there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But when it's heavy bombardment, dad comes down too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: At this moment, I just want to not be bombed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has had a devastating impact on all aspects of life here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And as it's the case with other armed conflicts, children have been hit particularly hard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I don't think that there is a single child in Ukraine who hasn't been touched in some way or another by this conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: who hasn't been touched in some way or another by this conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: You know, in the most severe cases, children who have been exposed directly to the violence, to weeks of bombing, living underground in shelters, you know, this can bring on post-traumatic stress disorder.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Mass displacement has left children exposed to human trafficking and sexual exploitation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: While the conflict itself puts millions at risk of being maimed or worse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Since the start of the war, over 200 children have lost their lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: You don't need science to kind of ask, are children going to be harmed by this?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Dr. Jack Shonkov from the Center on the Developing Child at Harvard University told Euronews children will bear the scars of this conflict one way or another well into their adult years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: What's going on inside the body when the stress system is activated?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Stress hormone levels increase in our bloodstream.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Our heart rate goes up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our blood pressure goes up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Our immune system is activated. So inflammation is elevated inside the body. Our blood sugar levels are going up, bringing energy to our brain to think more clearly and to our muscles to fight or run. And all of those systems, if they don't come back to baseline, then start to have a wear and tear effect on parts of the brain, which can affect your behavior, your mental status, and your mental health.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But they can also affect your cardiovascular system and your immune system and your metabolic systems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And a wear and tear effect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So yes, mental health problems are immensely important, but so will physical health problems be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But they will appear later later in the future which is something people here are struggling to picture for now i don't know what can i plan today there is no point in guessing the future. A rocket comes and we cease to exist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I don't see the point in talking about the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We live by the day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Annalise Borges in Mykolaiv, southern Ukraine, for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This year's World Economic Forum kicks off on Monday in the Swiss Alpine resort of Davos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Amidst enhanced security, some of the most powerful and influential leaders on the planet will be talking about soaring prices, the war in Ukraine, drought, food shortages and the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And just in case they're tempted to forget, the climate protesters are out in force to remind them of what many see as still the biggest challenge facing humanity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The demonstrators accused world leaders of putting profits over people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I think there are a lot of things that change, but in the end the big steps were not made yet, and we need big steps that we actually tackle the climate crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And I see that there is a shift in values slowly, and that people talk about it more, and it's more important, it's more on the agenda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is due to address the delegates by video link on Monday. Normally Russian leaders would be there, but this year Russia House has been renamed Russia War Crimes House. It will host an exhibition highlighting alleged crimes and cruelties. The World Economic Forum 2022 is on and this time Davos exceptionally is taking place in Maine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: You can see the view right here behind me, which is so different from the usual snowy mountains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Davos, the forum has been postponed for a while because of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And now when the world decision makers business leaders when they're coming here for the week of meetings they will be discussing the kovi 19 pandemic and how to deal with it they will be talking about the climate change which is such an important issue here in davos but at the top of the agenda is the war in ukraine ukraine's president volodymyr zelensky is addressing davos on monday he's the first keynote speaker here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We're going to also hear from Spain's Pedro Sanchez, from the European Commission president, Ruslan von der Leyen, and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz.
